name: Harry Potter Philosopher's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, where a young wizard named Harry Potter discovers his magical heritage.

authors.name: J.K. Rowling
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of the Harry Potter series.

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream in the 1920s.

authors.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'The Great Gatsby.'

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's timeless novel explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.

authors.name: Harper Lee
authors.briefdescription: Pulitzer Prize-winning author of 'To Kill a Mockingbird.'

name: Nineteen Eighty-Four
description: George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece explores a totalitarian society where surveillance and control are omnipresent.

authors.name: George Orwell
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'Nineteen Eighty-Four.'

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel follows the journey of Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager, through the streets of New York City.

authors.name: J. D. Salinger
authors.briefdescription: Iconic author of 'The Catcher in the Rye.'

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy follows the adventures of Frodo Baggins and his quest to destroy the One Ring.

authors.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'The Lord of the Rings.'

name: Anna Karenina
description: Leo Tolstoy's classic novel delves into the complexities of love, society, and morality through the story of Anna Karenina.

authors.name: Leo Tolstoy
authors.briefdescription: Iconic author of 'Anna Karenina.'

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: Gabriel García Márquez's iconic work tells the multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

authors.name: Gabriel García Márquez
authors.briefdescription: Nobel laureate and author of 'One Hundred Years of Solitude.'

name: Ulysses
description: James Joyce's groundbreaking modernist novel captures a single day in the life of Leopold Bloom as he navigates the streets of Dublin.

authors.name: James Joyce
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'Ulysses.'

name: Don Quixote
description: Miguel de Cervantes' masterpiece chronicles the adventures of the delusional Don Quixote and his loyal squire Sancho Panza.

authors.name: Miguel de Cervantes
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'Don Quixote,' considered one of the greatest works in world literature.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's beloved novel explores themes of class, love, and societal expectations in Regency-era England.

authors.name: Jane Austen
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'Pride and Prejudice.'

name: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic novel tells the harrowing tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for the great white whale, Moby-Dick.

authors.name: Herman Melville
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'Moby-Dick,' one of the most celebrated works in American literature.

name: War and Peace
description: Leo Tolstoy's epic novel explores the lives of five aristocratic Russian families during the Napoleonic era.

authors.name: Leo Tolstoy
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'War and Peace,' one of the greatest works of world literature.

name: Mrs Dalloway
description: Virginia Woolf's innovative novel follows a day in the life of Clarissa Dalloway as she prepares for a party in post-World War I London.

authors.name: Virginia Woolf
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'Mrs Dalloway.'

name: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte Brontë's classic novel tells the story of the orphaned Jane Eyre as she faces adversity and seeks love and independence.

authors.name: Charlotte Brontë
authors.briefdescription: Renowned author of 'Jane Eyre.'

name: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Mark Twain's classic novel follows the adventures of a young boy, Huck, as he travels down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave, Jim.

authors.name: Mark Twain
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn,' a quintessential American novel.

name: Crime and Punishment
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's psychological thriller explores the moral dilemmas of a young student, Raskolnikov, who commits a murder.

authors.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'Crime and Punishment,' a master of psychological fiction.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's masterpiece explores the moral and philosophical dilemmas of the Karamazov brothers.

authors.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'The Brothers Karamazov,' a master of philosophical fiction.

name: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
description: Embark on a magical adventure with the Pevensie siblings in the land of Narnia, where they encounter talking animals and the mystical White Witch.

authors.name: C. S. Lewis
authors.briefdescription: Author of 'The Chronicles of Narnia' series and a prominent theologian.

name: Frankenstein
description: Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus is a novel written by Mary Shelley. It tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque but sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

authors.name: Mary Shelley
authors.briefdescription: English novelist, short-story writer, dramatist, essayist, biographer, and travel writer. Best known for her Gothic novel Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus.

name: In Search of Lost Time
description: In Search of Lost Time, also known as Remembrance of Things Past, is a novel by Marcel Proust. It is considered one of the most important works of modernist literature.

authors.name: Marcel Proust
authors.briefdescription: French novelist, critic, and essayist best known for his monumental novel In Search of Lost Time. Proust's work is considered one of the most influential works of the 20th century.

name: The Odyssey
description: An epic ancient Greek poem attributed to Homer, which follows the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

authors.name: Homer
authors.briefdescription: Ancient Greek poet traditionally said to be the author of The Odyssey.

name: Animal Farm
description: A satirical novella by George Orwell, which uses a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer as an allegory for the events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917.

authors.name: George Orwell
authors.briefdescription: English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic known for his works on social and political issues.

name: Hamlet
description: A tragedy written by William Shakespeare that explores themes of revenge, betrayal, and madness.

authors.name: William Shakespeare
authors.briefdescription: English playwright and poet regarded as one of the greatest writers in the English language.

name: Gone with the Wind
description: A historical novel by Margaret Mitchell set against the backdrop of the American Civil War and Reconstruction era.

authors.name: Margaret Mitchell
authors.briefdescription: American author best known for her epic novel 'Gone with the Wind.'

name: The Divine Comedy
description: An epic poem by Dante Alighieri that explores the journey of the soul through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

authors.name: Dante Alighieri
authors.briefdescription: Italian poet, writer, and philosopher known for 'The Divine Comedy.'

name: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
description: A classic novel by Lewis Carroll that follows Alice as she ventures into a fantastical world filled with peculiar creatures and whimsical adventures.

authors.name: Lewis Carroll
authors.briefdescription: English author, mathematician, and logician best known for his imaginative works.

name: One Thousand and One Nights
description: A collection of Middle Eastern folktales and stories, including the tales of Aladdin, Sinbad, and Ali Baba.

authors.name: Hanna Al-Shaykh
authors.briefdescription: Lebanese author known for her contemporary retelling of traditional stories.

name: Gulliver's Travels
description: A satirical novel by Jonathan Swift that follows Lemuel Gulliver's adventures in Lilliput and other fantastical lands.

authors.name: Jonathan Swift
authors.briefdescription: Anglo-Irish satirist, essayist, and author best known for 'Gulliver's Travels.'

name: The Stories of Anton Chekhov
description: A collection of Anton Chekhov's short stories, known for their deep insights into human nature and Russian society.

authors.name: Anton Chekhov
authors.briefdescription: Russian playwright and short-story writer known for his masterful storytelling.

name: The Little Prince
description: A beloved novella by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry that tells the story of a young prince's adventures and life lessons.

authors.name: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
authors.briefdescription: French writer, poet, and aviator known for his classic work 'The Little Prince.'

name: Invisible Man
description: A powerful novel by Ralph Ellison that explores issues of identity, race, and social invisibility.

authors.name: Ralph Ellison
authors.briefdescription: African American novelist and essayist known for his groundbreaking work 'Invisible Man.'

name: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker's classic gothic horror novel that introduced Count Dracula to the world.

authors.name: Bram Stoker
authors.briefdescription: Irish author best known for his iconic vampire novel, 'Dracula.'

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: Kurt Vonnegut's anti-war novel that blends science fiction with satire to explore the horrors of war.

authors.name: Kurt Vonnegut
authors.briefdescription: American author known for his distinctive and satirical style.

name: Fahrenheit 451
description: Ray Bradbury's dystopian novel depicting a future society where books are banned and burned.

authors.name: Ray Bradbury
authors.briefdescription: American author known for his imaginative and thought-provoking science fiction and fantasy works.

name: Madame Bovary
description: Gustave Flaubert's novel about the tragic life of Emma Bovary, a young woman trapped in a loveless marriage.

authors.name: Gustave Flaubert
authors.briefdescription: French novelist known for his literary realism and meticulous writing style.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: Alexandre Dumas' epic tale of betrayal, revenge, and redemption in 19th-century France.

authors.name: Alexandre Dumas
authors.briefdescription: French novelist known for his historical adventure novels and vivid storytelling.

name: To the Lighthouse
description: Virginia Woolf's modernist masterpiece that explores the inner thoughts and experiences of its characters.

authors.name: Virginia Woolf
authors.briefdescription: An influential English writer and a key figure in the modernist literary movement.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: Oscar Wilde's classic novel about the price of eternal youth and the consequences of moral decay.

authors.name: Oscar Wilde
authors.briefdescription: A brilliant Irish writer known for his wit and literary works.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's timeless tale of adventure in Middle-earth.

authors.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
authors.briefdescription: A master storyteller and creator of Middle-earth.

name: A Christmas Carol
description: Charles Dickens' timeless holiday tale of redemption.

authors.name: Charles Dickens
authors.briefdescription: A renowned Victorian novelist known for his classic works.

name: The Scarlet Letter
description: Nathaniel Hawthorne's classic novel exploring the consequences of sin.

authors.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne
authors.briefdescription: An American novelist and short story writer known for his literary works.

name: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's best-selling novel about a shepherd's journey to find his personal legend.

authors.name: Paulo Coelho
authors.briefdescription: A Brazilian author known for his inspirational works.

name: Cloud Atlas
description: David Mitchell's mesmerizing novel that weaves together multiple stories across time and space.

authors.name: David Mitchell
authors.briefdescription: An English author known for his innovative storytelling.

name: Life of Pi
description: Yann Martel's captivating novel about survival and storytelling.

authors.name: Yann Martel
authors.briefdescription: A Canadian author known for his imaginative storytelling.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: A gripping thriller by Stieg Larsson.

authors.name: Stieg Larsson
authors.briefdescription: Swedish author and journalist known for his Millennium series.

name: Dune
description: A classic science fiction novel by Frank Herbert.

authors.name: Frank Herbert
authors.briefdescription: American science fiction author known for the Dune series.

name: Da Vinci Code
description: A thrilling mystery novel by Dan Brown.

authors.name: Dan Brown
authors.briefdescription: American author known for his thriller novels.
